message:
Anyone tried to install Hyper-V inside another Hyper-V ?

the scenario : i have an Azure VM running Windows Server 2012 , i have added the role for the Hyper-V(include Management Service) from the command line, after restart i couldn't find any way to open it however the Services is running in the Taskman , i want to run the Windows Phone 8 SDK Emulator inside this VM but it failed because one of the Hyper-V component can't started.

Any Ideas to solve the problem would be appreciated.

data.message:
Welcome to my hell :D
I tried last week. Same reason. Short story, you can't.
In theory you can install everything except the VM, and then you can build your WP8 project, but not run it.
Only Parallels and VMWare support nested virtualization. VirtualBox and Hyper-V don't.

LOL :D  , وفرت عليا الحقيقة :D , اه تمام انا فعلأ جربت أعمل Build وكل حاجة تمام وبعدين المحاكي بيبدأ يفتح كده ويقوم مطلع المشكلة دي , وبعد البحث فعلاً لقيت في ناس عملتها على ماك زي ما بتقول , بس ايه الغباء ده بعد ما اضيف الـ Hyper-V Role والـ Services شغاله ما أقدرش أستخدمها :D هو أه ماكنش راضي يخليني أثبتها عشان الـ Hypervisor بس ضفتها من الباورشل.
يلا مش مشكلة مش مكتوبالي عشان كنت بفكر في فكرة شريرة :D
kont btfkr f e kda y dev d e7na awl youm eid i :D
you can nest Hyper-V inside a VM using VMware Workstation OR you can boot directly from the .vhd file .. in case of Azure I don't think you can :)

maybe you can upload one of WP8's vhd images (they're somewhere in Program Files I think) onto azure and have an Azure VM running WP8 (similar to how you do that on your laptop without the emulator UI), but then you wont be able to deploy anything to it because you don't have access to the host OS (which I believe is Windows Azure itself)
